channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate GOP campaign chair 'concerned' over fundraising disparity but predicts who will win majority
item.description: Senate GOP campaign committee chair Steve Daines says the fundraising disparity is a concern as the Republicans work to win back the majority from the Democrats, but he predicts victory in November.

item.title: Renowned presidential prognosticator Allan Lichtman reveals his 2024 prediction
item.description: American University historian Allan Lichtman has predicted the winner of the presidential popular vote every November since 1984, even bucking the conventional wisdom to pick Donald Trump in 2016.

item.title: The Goldman Case Puts a Nation on Trial
item.description: Cédric Kahn’s landmark courtroom movie does what American filmmakers can’t.

item.title: Desperate Democrats Are Pushing Yet Another Version Of The Russia Collusion Hoax
item.description: The truth is, Russia isn’t interfering in the 2024 election nearly as much as Biden’s FBI and DOJ are right now.

item.title: 2024 Cash Dash: Harris nearly triples Trump's fundraising last month
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris raked in a staggering $361 million in fundraising in August, her campaign announced on Friday morning, nearly triple what Donald Trump's campaign raised

item.title: Prosecutor challenges Mark Meadows' bid to move Arizona's fake elector case to federal court
item.description: A prosecutor urged a judge on Thursday to reject former Donald Trump presidential chief of staff Mark Meadows' bid to move his charges in Arizona's fake elector case to federal court, saying his actions in trying to overturn the 2020 election results weren't part of his job at the White House.

item.title: Pro-Life Realism Post-Dobbs
item.description: Pro-lifers must hold whatever modest ground they can. And they have reasons to hope.

item.title: After Attempted Alford Plea, Hunter Biden Reluctantly Pleads Guilty To Avoid Messy Trial
item.description: Hunter Biden's defense attempted to change his plea from 'not guilty' to an 'Alford plea' and thereby avoid a trial.

item.title: House Republicans privately worry about political fallout of government shutdown
item.description: Some Republicans are already starting to worry that they will be blamed for a partial government shutdown if the House and Senate fail to reach a deal by Oct. 1.

item.title: RNC issues reality check on candidates' economic claims
item.description: The Republican National Committee continues to monitor claims that Vice President Kamala Harris makes when she is offering a speech on the campaign trail. The committee is also watching how her main rival is faring.

item.title: The Week: Welcome to the Stretch Run
item.description: Plus: Shohei Ohtani is just incredible.

item.title: Harris And Walz Avoiding The Press Isn’t A Savvy Campaign Strategy — They’re Just Cowards
item.description: Even The New York Times thinks Kamala Harris' answers are 'vague' and 'vacuous' — why is someone this scared of opening her mouth running for president?

item.title: Senate GOP bracing for last-minute leader bids — potentially by key Trump ally
item.description: Steve Daines is speculated as a potential candidate for Senate GOP leader in November, but he isn't announcing any such bid just yet.

item.title: Republican lawmaker says GOP will lose the House in November
item.description: Rep. Tony Gonzales believed that House Republicans, who hold a razor-thin majority in the lower chamber, will lose the House in November.

item.title: What Happened to National Honor?
item.description: No one is ever going to mistake Joe Biden for Teddy Roosevelt.

item.title: Trump Pledges To Create Elon Musk-Led ‘Government Efficiency Commission’ In Major Economic Address
item.description: During a major economic speech on Thursday, former President Donald Trump pledged to create a “government efficiency commission” spearheaded by X owner Elon Musk if elected this November. This commission will be “tasked with conducting a complete financial and performance audit of the entire federal government and making recommendations for drastic reforms,” the 2024 GOP […]

item.title: Trump suggests he could win 50% of Jewish vote in presidential election showdown against Harris
item.description: Former President Trump suggested that he could win up to half of the Jewish vote in the 2024 election as he criticized Jewish Americans who support Vice President Kamala Harris

item.title: Hunter Biden makes shock guilty plea in tax fraud case
item.description: President Biden's son, Hunter Biden, pleaded guilty Thursday to tax evasion charges, dodging a trial that would have dredged up sordid details about his past spending on strippers and drugs as his father serves out his remaining months in the White House in the midst of the presidential election.

item.title: Fight DEI in Higher Ed with Grades
item.description: To contest a worldview whose ultimate goal is to destroy merit, schools should double down on objective measurements of student success.

item.title: Democrats Are Weaponizing Dark Money And Ballot Initiatives To Turn Red States Blue
item.description: Left-wing groups funded by Dems' dark money machine have put initiatives on the 2024 ballot that seek to enshrine radical policies into law.
